a.span: PA Cyber-Charter School Information- By Mark Spengler, Express-Times Guest Columnist

div.style: height: 491px;background-image: url("/uploads/1/3/2/6/13265194/background-images/1962494934.jpg") ;background-repeat: no-repeat ;background-position: undefined undefined ;background-size: 100% ;background-color: transparent ;background-size: cover;

td.div:
Dear Community Members:
Hopefully everyone is continuing to stay healthy and safe through these trying times. I will be writing to you each week to keep you informed of school district events. The following are items for your interest within our school district:
1. As soon as schools were closed due to the coronavirus, we immediately started to feed our students. We have continued this practice, which has benefitted many of our school families. The feeding program will go until Friday, May 29, 2020. The schedule will remain the same:
• Monday Distribution: Breakfast and lunch for Monday & Tuesday
• Wednesday Distribution: Breakfast and lunch for Wednesday & Thursday
• Friday Distribution: Breakfast and lunch for Friday, Saturday & Sunday
2. I am very proud of our teachers who have done an outstanding job in producing assignments for our students. They have worked extremely hard in reaching out to their students. I would ask our school families to continue to pick up new assignments on Fridays and return completed assignments on Fridays. Working together will get us through these trying times.
3. Within this update, I have included two surveys for you to complete:
• Access to Food Survey
• Family Check-In Survey
Please fill out the short surveys, which will help us as we continue to reach out to our school families. We want to help, but need to know who is requesting our assistance.
As always, if you have any questions or concerns, please contact me.
Dennis Crotzer
Superintendent
Johnsonburg Area School District
https://forms.gle/FpBRqJcA1RmwtgXD9
https://survey123.arcgis.com/share/00f41ab0fcb84640a93f5b62d433c597?fbclid=IwAR3d_vSPLc18RmR04nPTPlwU4c_r49vBg_Uo5HH9ecRVf5Bcdygobz3kDVM
Dear Community Members:
As you know, Governor Wolf announced last Thursday that all school districts would be closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Unfortunately, we are not able to finish a school year like in the past, but the health and safety of everyone is of paramount importance. The following are items for your interest within our school district:
The administration is working on a plan for graduation. Many details need to be worked out. When the final arrangements are made, I will inform you.
With the abrupt ending to the school year, students have many belongings in their respective school. Our high school students will be able to pick up their items from April 20-23, 2020. Mr. Kelly will send a schedule out to each high school student tomorrow asking for him or her to sign up for a time. Elementary students will be given all of their items on May 1, 2020, when they pick up their weekly assignments. If you have any questions, please call your child’s principal.
Our high school students will receive scheduling materials for the 2020-21 school year during the week of April 27. These materials will be sent home with their report cards.
Mrs. Allegretto will be scheduling the Kindergarten Readiness tests for our incoming Kindergarten students. This testing will be done during the summer. Notification will be sent out at a later time.
Mrs. Charney is working on refunds for our senior class members. The trip to Florida was cancelled and she is working on getting the money back to our students.
We will continue to deliver food to our students. A reminder that pick-up times are as follows:
Duffy Apartments and the Wilcox Legion: 9:00 a.m. – 9:40 a.m.
Memorial Field and Holy Rosary: 10:00 a.m. – 10:40 a.m.
As always, if you have any questions or concerns, please contact me.
Dennis Crotzer
Superintendent
Johnsonburg Area School District
​Dear Community Members:
I hope that everything is fine with you and your family as we battle the coronavirus. The following are items for your interest within our school district:
As I mentioned in yesterday’s announcement, Governor Wolf has announced that all Pre-K - grade 12 schools remain closed until further notice.
The Johnsonburg Area School District has created and will implement a Continuity of Education plan. This plan will be posted on our website and will be sent to the Pennsylvania Department of Education.
Students at our elementary school will be doing paper-based assignments, which our teachers have prepared. Teachers at our high school will have assignments for students either on-line or a paper/pencil format.
Distribution of materials will be held on Friday, April 3, 2020. The following schedule will be used for both schools:
Student last names beginning with A-J: 9:00 a.m. – 10:30 a.m.
Student last names beginning with K-Z 10:30 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. Please pay attention to traffic patterns and remain in your car at all times. On a piece of paper, largely print student name(s), homeroom teacher, and grade level. Show this through your car window to awaiting staff. If you need to sign a computer agreement form for a Johnsonburg Area School District laptop, please bring your own pen. It is important to utilize aggressive social distancing during this time so that everyone involved can remain safe. Be patient while we get this completed as quickly as possible. Thank you for your assistance.
Assignments that are sent home must be returned to your child’s respective school by Thursday, April 9, 2020 at 12:00 p.m. This will also be the last day of the third quarter. Assignments for the fourth quarter will also be available for pick up.
Report cards will be sent home for our elementary students on April 24, 2020. High school report cards will be sent home during the week of April 27.
Delivery of food for our students has been going great. I would like to modify the pickup times as follows:
Duffy Apartments and the Wilcox Legion: 9:00 a.m. 9:40 a.m.
Memorial Field and Holy Rosary: 10:00 – 10:40 a.m.
Zitomedia is offering economically disadvantaged students internet if the student’s family meets the following criteria:
They have no outstanding balance with Zitomedia
Are not a current customer of Zitomedia nor have they been a customer within the last six months
Can provide proof of economically disadvantaged status – such as free lunch eligibility with the school, welfare, etc.
The prom has been cancelled. When we return to school, we will work on an alternate plan for our students.
Our breakfast/lunch schedule for the Easter holiday is:
April 6 - food for Monday and Tuesday
April 8 - food for Wednesday, Thursday & Friday
April 10- No delivery
April 11-14 No delivery
April 15- Resume delivery
At this time, we are working on a plan for students to collect their belongings from their locker. Therefore, no student or unauthorized adult is permitted in either school to pick up anything.
My sincere thanks to everyone who has helped me maintain the structure of operating a school district.
If you have any questions, please contact me.
Dennis Crotzer
Superintendent
Johnsonburg Area School District
Dear Community Members:
I would like to address various items in regards to our school district and the coronavirus:
We have started to feed our students with breakfast and lunch. A flyer is enclosed detailing the program.​
Please do not visit either school. I am not permitted to allow visitors at this time
Schools are not permitted to have people use playgrounds, basketball courts, etc. at any time.
Our maintenance staff is working extremely hard in cleaning both schools.
The senior trip is cancelled. When we return to school, we will work on something for our seniors.
All fundraising delivery dates are postponed at this time.
At this time, spring sports are suspended. We have not heard when and/or if they will resume.
Please check our Facebook page for educational sites that your children can utilize during this time off from school.
Governor Wolf has closed all school districts from March 16-30, 2020. When I know more of a re-opening date, I will notify you.
We are awaiting more directions from the College Board in regards to AP testing. When I receive word, I will pass it along. Also, I have not received word concerning this year’s PSSA & Keystone exams.
This time is very unsettling. My administrative staff, central office staff, and secretarial staff are working extremely hard in helping with the continuing daily operation of our school district.
If you have any questions, please contact me.
Dennis Crotzer
Superintendent
Johnsonburg Area School District

strong.font: Johnsonburg Area School District Feeding Program

br.br:
The Johnsonburg Area School District will be providing breakfast and lunch to all interested children age 0 through 18 years. Delivery days will be Monday, Wednesday, and Fridays. Monday and Wednesday delivery will be for 2 days and Friday will be for 3 days.
Drop Off Sites are in the parking lots as follows:
9:00 AM – 9:50 AM Duffy Apartment and Wilcox Legion
10:00 AM – 11:00 AM Holy Rosary School and Memorial Field
To register for the meals, please complete the survey shorturl.at/rtAIR or call the Central Office at 965-2536 Ext. 3404. You only have to register once.

h2.font:
Johnsonburg Area School District
Mr. Dennis Crotzer, Superintendent
315 High School Road, Johnsonburg, PA 15845
814-965-2536 - 814-965-5809 (fax)
